Comment: Very interesting challenge. Maybe better in fastest mode (as said by @Joal12). It will maybe be harder for newbie with no list management knowledge but very fun to solve.

Comment: Très bon test! Différent de ceux que l'on voit d'habitude! Il peut être vraiment très intéressant dans le mode rapide plus que dans shortest.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I really like this contribution, it can be fun in all the modes except reverse I guess
I think you should add it in reverse mode, it could be fun

I wonder if it would be clearer to rename the output `m`  to `month`, so that you use `day` and `month` for the two placeholders that are expecting strings and d and y for the integers - in most date format strings I've come across, d/m refer to integer parts of the date so I was initially confused that I needed a word.

Goal
* Suggest to change "the day [[d]] of the month [[m]]" to "the day [[d]] and the month [[m]]".

* In the first sentence you write "It's New Years Day" ("Years" without the apostrophe), and subsequently you write "Today is New Year's Day (1st of January)." ("Year's" with the apostrophe). Suggest to move the second sentence to replace the first quoted phrase to avoid repetition and simplify the text.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer" or "write date").

Thanks.

Every time you say Advent you always put a 1. before it; is this just part of the name of the holiday or is there another reason?

If possible could you say "The 1. Advent is the fours Sunday before the 25th of December" and "Today is the 1st of January"? I think it just sounds smoother especially because you already said New Year's Day and Christmas.

Finally, I think there's enough information in the parenthesis at the end to make a new section. Same with "Today is New Years Day"; I think a few new lines would just structure the entire thing well.
Thanks. I replaced "1. Advent" by Advent Sunday. I hadn't realized that it is called like that in English. Added a couple of new lines, too.
Thanks, I followed the suggestion: Simplified  description, consistent spelling and write statement in the stub generator.
